result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Troy A Leisten was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS elgible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 1 day.

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Blood draw test to be forwarded to the Waukesha Sheriff's Dept.
$26.00 for TRANSCRIPT FEE to be paid to the DA's office.
Submit to AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug/urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign medical release for Agent.
Within 60 days become involved in a 12 step program and obtain a sponsor/mentor.
Operate a MV with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge.

Count 3 dismissed outright.
Cases 14TR3313, 14TR3648, 14TR3649, 14FO367, 14FO368, and 14FO369 were dismissed and read into: 14CF645.

BAIL OF $1,689.00 APPLIED TO FINE. $19.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

superTimeConds.notes: 20 hours of community service per each year on Extended Supervison.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel on: within the first 6 months of release onto extended supervision.

Kees acknowledges receipt but notes there is not a PAC charge.  Court accepts and notes that the defendant previously entered a not guilty plea.  Atty. Defendant Troy A. Leisten in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

requesting refusal hearing.
filed by Attorney Anna Kees.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program after his release from jail.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
